data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held in Room 1309, Longworth House
Representatives Lofgren, Raskin, Cheney, and Kinzinger.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
AND OF CHAIR TO THE VICE CHAIR
This is a deposition of Dr. John Eastman conducted by the House Select
Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the U.S. Capitol.
I'm a senior investigative counsel for the committee,
and I'm also of counsel to the vice chair of the committee, Representative Liz Cheney.
And I'll let everybody introduce themselves.
_ , senior counsel to the vice chair.
investigative counsel to the select committee.
_ , senior investigative counsel to the committee.
Charles Burnham, counsel for Dr. John Eastman.
And just to let you know, there may be members of the committee
that will either come in person or participate by video.
try to let you know and say on the record when members join.
We will keep an eye on that to
We probably won't say on the record when they leave just because if they're by

record might not always show when the members leave.
The questions will be led by staff, but we will occasionally pause and see if any of

As you know, there is a court reporter here.
And why don't we go ahead and administer the oath?
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury that the

If you either don't hear a question or don't understand a question, please say so,
so that we can either repeat it or try to clarify it.
the answer, feel free to say so.
Also, if you don't recall or don't know

let us know who's here and who's coming?

We wish to preserve the objections in full noted in the letter I referred to a
They'll show up on this big TV here?

moment ago, but need not elaborate on them further here, with one exception.
I wish to emphasize to the committee the importance of the Fifth Amendment to
the United States Constitution, which I have counseled my client to invoke.
This right is fundamental to our system of justice.
As I stated in my letter, our
Supreme Court has called the Fifth Amendment a safeguard against heedless, unfounded,
or tyrannical prosecution to protect the innocent, as well as the guilty.
Invoking the Fifth Amendment is not an admission of guilt and no one should
so many law-abiding Americans have done throughout history.
We make no apologies for seeking Fifth Amendment protection as
In asserting this privilege on my client's behalf, I cannot reveal information
the importance of which I need not explain to a committee with distinguished lawyers
Doing so would violate my duty as a lawyer,
But, in fact, there is no need to reveal privileged information to establish Dr.
Eastman's basis for Fifth Amendment protection.
One need only look to the public
record to understand why claiming the Fifth Amendment is a necessity forced upon Dr.
I have detailed on pages 8 and 9 of my letter, which is now a part of the record,
examples of statements from committee members and other voices of influence which
made clear that Dr. Eastman has a legitimate fear of criminal prosecution.
I could offer many additional examples beyond those in my letter, but out of
respect for this committee's time, I will limit myself to two further examples beyond what
I've already put in the letter.
According to news reports, on December 1st a United States
district judge, who herself has a background in Federal prosecution, stated during the
criminal sentencing of a defendant charged with committing crimes on January 6th that
the President, former President Trump, and others who spoke at the rally on the Ellipse
that day, quote, "bear greater responsibility and should be held accountable," unquote.
This from a judge in the very courthouse where over 600 people were criminally charged
My second example, second and final example, is there is an active bar complaint
against Dr. Eastman in California bearing on the exact subject matter of this deposition.
The bar complaint alleges that Dr. Eastman may have assisted former President Donald
Trump in criminal conduct in connection with the 2020 election and January 6th.
In other words, there is currently pending today against Dr. Eastman formal legal
process specifically alleging criminal activity in connection with the very event described
in the cover letter to this committee's subpoena.
I submit that based on these facts, Dr. Eastman has a clear case, as clear a case for
Fifth Amendment protection as this committee -- or indeed any committee -- is ever likely
In closing, I wish to emphasis that Dr. Eastman's purpose here is simply to do his
recognizes his legitimate responsibilities to the United States Congress.
Dr. Eastman is a distinguished lawyer and scholar of the law.

requested, be offered on a question-by-question basis.
request and Dr. Eastman has come here today from far out of town, at his own expense,
